newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper called to open higher.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper called to open higher.

text.p: COMEX copper futures were called to open higher Thursday as the market rebounded modestly from its recent sharp drop despite a hefty rise in LME stocks overnight.
COMEX September copper was called up 1.00 to 2.00 cents from Wednesday's close of 108.80 cents a lb after trading between 110.90 and 108.90 cents on ACCESS.
LME stocks rose 1,625 tonnes Thursday to 124,750 tonnes.
COMEX stocks Wednesday fell 635 short tons to 49,645 short tons.
The cash to three months backwardation in London firmed again overnight by about $15 to $128/$133.
